Which of the following pairs of salts undergo hydrolysis?
explanation: Salt hydrolysis isa reaction in which one of the ions from a salt reacts with water, forming either an acidic or basic solution.Salts can be hydrolyzed in water, If the salts at least consist of one weak base or weak acid, they can be hydrolyzed. On the other hand, if the salts are from a strong base and acid, they cannot be hydrolyzed.Al and \(NH_4\) are from weak base \(Al(OH)_3\) and \(NH_4OH\) respectively while Cl is from a strong acid HCl

\(MnO_{2(s)} + xHCI_{(aq)} → MnCI_{2(g)} + yH_2O_{(l)} + zCI_{2(g)}\)

Two solutions containing Pb2+ and AI3+ respectively can be distinguished using
explanation: HCl (hydrochloric acid) can be used to distinguish between Pb\(^{2+}\) and Al\(^{3+}\) because lead ions (Pb\(^{2+}\)) form a white precipitate (PbCl\(_2\)) when reacted with HCl, while aluminum ions (Al\(^{3+}\)) do not.

text: When ammonium trioxocarbonate (IV) solution is added to separate solutions of calcium, zinc and sodium salt precipitate could be formed in the case of
The condensation of several amino acid molecules gives

Which of the following statements is true of an endothermic reaction? I. Heat is absorbed from the surrounding II. The heat content of the products is more than that of the reactants III. The enthalpy change is positive IV. The surrounding is at a lower temperature than the system.
explanation: For an endothermic reaction; heat flows from the surroundings to the system( but that doesn't make the surroundings to be at a lower temperature than the system) meaning the surroundings are at a higher temperature than the system. The system's enthalpy change, i.e. ΔH is positive or > 0. The heat content of the product is more than that of the reactant.
